Description: failure to provide required benefits in health plan
Info Source: Attorney General Martha Coakley Reaches Settlement with Two Health Insurers that Failed to Provide Mandated Benefits, States News Service, July 18, 2007 (via Nexis).

Agency: Arizona Department of Insurance and Financial Institutions
Notes: This case was brought by the Arizona Department of Insurance before it merged with the Department of Financial Institutions.

Company: Time Insurance Co. and John Alden Life Insurance Co. and Union Securitiy Insurance Co.
Description: Time Insurance Co., John Alden Life Insurance Co. and Union Securitiy Insurance Co. agreed to repay $2,750,000 in premiums (less any amounts required to be refunded by PPACA), and to pay a $100,000 penalty and $100,000 in costs, in settlement of allegations they charged small employers medical premiums that were above those approved by the department.

Time Insurance Co., Union Security Insurance Co. and John Alden Life Insurance Co. agreed to pay a $500,000 voluntary forfeiture and make a $500,000 donation to charity in settlement of allegations they had failed to pay valid health insurance claims and had made errors in claims and handling complaints.

Info Source: CONSUMER COMPLAINT LEADS TO $524,000 FINE FOR TIME INSURANCE COMPANY, US State News, September 23, 2013 (via Nexis).

Description: Fine levied for failing to notify consumer of a review decision within fourteen days of receipt of request for review; failing to extend the time it takes to make a review determination. WAC 284-43-525(1); WAC 284-43-525(2)
Agency: Washington State Office of the Insurance Commissioner
Wisconsin Office of the Commissioner of Insurance
